description: While swathes of Europe are under lockdown, Sweden is allowing life to go on much as normal.
title: Lockdown, what lockdown? Sweden's unusual response to coronavirus
title_page: Lockdown, what lockdown? Sweden's unusual response to coronavirus - BBC News
maintext: Demography may also be a relevant factor in the country's approach. In contrast to the multi-generational homes in Mediterranean countries, more than half of Swedish households are made up of one person, which cuts the risk of the virus spreading within families.
